at_play1.description: Sometime over the last month or two, Felix turned a corner on Legos.  Before, we did most of the building.   Now it's all him, unless it's a tricky multi-story castle.  He's especially good at spaceships (pictured here). He pays attention to symmetry, structural strentgh and colors.
at_play1.title: At Play 1

at_play2.description: Milo has truly entered the age of pretend play. Here he plays doctor with Nounours. Other favorite games:  pretend eating and pretending to be a dog.
at_play2.title: At Play 2

at_play3.description: If Milo had to be cast away on a island, the only toy he would pack would be a ball. He never gets tired of it. It's actually fun to kick around with him; he really gets it.
at_play3.title: At Play 3

insist1.description: When Milo wants something, he is determined. He looks stern, resolute, and whines with conviction.
insist1.title: Insist 1

insist2.description: However, if you make fun of his whining, it evaporates quicker than you can say "uddlegrumpus".
insist2.title: Insist 2

t-rexes.description:
How to get Felix eating chicken on the bone? The obvious strategy: pretend to be a family of Tyrannosaurs eating a Triceratops. There were involved discussions of exactly how Mom T-Rex got past the Triceratops' big bony head armor.

Milo has been on a protein binge. Last supper included 4 scrambled eggs and 1/2 a chicken breast, plus some pasta, applesauce and tangerines, washed down with milk. What is he going to be like as a teenager?
t-rexes.title: T Rexes

the_joyces1.description: Saturday night with the Joyces.  We ordered Indian food and jousted Hungry Hippos.
the_joyces1.title: The Joyces 1

the_joyces2.description: After the under-5 crowd went to bed, we switched to a card game.  It felt luxuriously adult.
the_joyces2.title: The Joyces 2

the_papa1.description: Dean and Milo ponder the eternal mysteries of the ceiling fan.
the_papa1.title: The Papa 1

the_papa2.description: Dean and Milo don't get much quality time during the week:  Milo retires soon after Dean returns from work; and the morning is a rush to get out of the house.  They make up for lost time on the weekend.
the_papa2.title: The Papa 2

the_papa3.description: Enough cuddling, let's kick a ball!
the_papa3.title: The Papa 3

torin1.description: Torin came over for the afternoon.  No room was left un-ransacked.
torin1.title: Torin 1

torin2.description: Milo and Torin have a thing. Hugs and kisses were exchanged.
torin2.title: Torin 2

torin3.description: Star Wars!  Torin is Princess Leia, Felix is Luke Skywalker.  They know they are brother and sister but they enjoyed some good fights anyway.  They agreed beforehand who would win:  typically, Torin.  Felix likes to fall on the ground, mortally wounded.
torin3.title: Torin 3

torin5.description: Milo tried very hard all afternoon to belong in their games, and was crushed the times he was flatly rejected.  Here he asked to be costumed up as Darth Vader.
torin5.title: Torin 5

description:
Monday was Martin Luther King Day, a holiday in Berkeley. Felix explains: "We had a birthday party for Martin Luther King at school. He's dead, but we made him a cake anyway." That's a step up from last year, when he said "We had a party for Martin Luther King, but he didn't show up."
Milo tries very hard to understand the rules of Felix's games and does his best to join them. He no longer grabs toys from Felix's hands, nor does he detroy Lego creations (or, at least, not as often). We are having trouble with teaching him not to throw... he doesn't get that it's sometimes okay (a ball), and sometimes a big no-no (he'll cheerfully throw a shoe at your face). Same problem with hitting, which comes from witnessing Felix mock-fighting.
title: January 16
